headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE,; Inauguration of the Louvre. Money Easier---Consols 91 1-2---Grain Better-Large Sales of Cotton--Prices Firm--India Trade, SPEECH OF THE EMPEROR. THE SPANISH-MEXICAN QUESTION. RAILWAY ABUSES IN ENGLAND. No News from India or Turkey. ARRIVAL OF THE ATLANTIS,

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Atlantic, Capt. ELDEIDGE, from Liverpool, at 10 o'clock morning of Wednesday, Aug. 19, arrived here at an early hour on Sunday morning, bringing 55 passengers and the mails. The steamship Asia arrived at Liverpool at 8 o'clock morning of Sunday, the 16th August.

docs.lead_paragraph: RUMORED DEATH OF MRS. GARDNER, OF HINGHAM, FROM POISON.--The Boston Traveller says: It has been stated that Mrs. GARDNER, mother of the late HOSEA GARDNER, Postmaster of Hingham, (who died from poison, for the administration of which his wife was arrested,) died at Hingham on Monday last. She has been in failing health ever since the tragical death of her son

headline.main: TRAVELING IN INDIA.; From Calcutta to Madras--Landing in the Surf--Railway to Vellore--Losing one's Servant and Baggage--A Hard-hearted Official--Bribery--The Bullock Transit--An East Indian Carriage--A Traveler's Bungalow--Railroad Routes from Madras to the Malabar Coast--The Neilgherries--Our Correspondent on his Journey to the Interior of Southern India.

docs.lead_paragraph: When your readers note the date of this letter, they may wonder from what part of the far East your correspondent is now writing. Have I escaped the sepoy slaughters in Bengal, to hide myself in the dominions of the Khan of Tartary ? or amIl rusticating among the cannibals of the Andaman Islands? You are puzzled ? headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH. THE ACCIDENT TO THE STEAMBOAT CROTON. FRAUDS ON THE REVENUE. ANOTHER FATAL CAMPHENE ACCIDENT. ARREST ON A CHARGE OF ARSON. PASSING A WORTHLESS CHECK. AREEST OF A ROWDY. OMNIBUSES. FOUND DROWNED. AN OLD MAN DROWNED. VISIT OF THE RANDALL'S ISLAND BOYS TO THE CITY. FELONIOUS ASSAULT.- The Ohio L fe and Trust Company--More Attachments. SUPREME COURT SUPREME COURT SUPREME COURT SUPER FOR COURT COURT OF COMMON PLEASANT

docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--At a meeting of the Commissioners of Health, held at the City Library Room, to-day, (Friday) at 12 1/2 o' clock, present President PHILLIPS and CLANUY, Commissioners MILLER, THOMPSON and ROOKWELL, the following business was transacted: A communication was received from the Croton Aqueduct Board in answer to a resolution requesting them to repave Madison street, between Roosevelt and Pearl street, for the purpose of remedying an existing nuisance as follows.
